topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Applying the Reverse Path Filter Patch

section.p: After deploying the HPE OpenStack cloud, you might not be able to access the Horizon interface and the OpenStack services cannot be accessed over the CAN network.
To prevent this problem, install a patch to configure the kernel to set the reverse path filter (rp_filter) to 1 in the all and default configuration files.
Note: You need the Ubuntu patch utility installed on the lifecycle manager host. If you do not have the utility installed, use the following command:

ol.li: Copy the rp_filter.tar.gz to the ~/patch_cghelion1.1 directory. cp rp_filter.tar.gz ~/patch_cghelion1.1
Use the following command to extract the rp_filter.tar.gz: tar -zxvf rp_filter.tar.gz

section.title: Apply the patch to the configuration processor

ol.li: Change to the following directory: cd ~/kenobi-node-configuration

Execute the following command to perform a dry-run of the patch to verify: patch -p1 --dry-run < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/rp_filter.patch
The output appears similar to the following:checking file ansible-playbooks/roles/FND-CLU/tasks/deploy.yml checking file ansible-playbooks/roles/FND-CLU/tasks/install.yml

Execute the following command to apply the patch:patch -p1 < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/rp_filter.patch
The output appears similar to the following:patching file ansible-playbooks/roles/FND-CLU/tasks/deploy.yml patching file ansible-playbooks/roles/FND-CLU/tasks/install.yml

section.title: Synchronize the Patch Files to the Environment

ol.li: Execute the following command to synch the patch file:./hlm_prepare-env.sh

body.p: Return to the KVM + ESX - installation.
